abstract: <jats:title>Abstract</jats:title><jats:p>This article is an update of the best practice guidelines for the molecular analysis of Prader-Willi and Angelman syndromes published in 2010 in BMC Medical Genetics [1]. The update takes into account developments in terms of techniques, differential diagnoses and (especially) reporting standards. It highlights the advantages and disadvantages of each method and moreover, is meant to facilitate the interpretation of the obtained results - leading to improved standardised reports.</jats:p>

assertion.name: Ethics
assertion.value: The authors declare that they have no conflict of interest.
